translation.en: -[woman laughing] -[Jon] I don't know.
translation.ko: "쿠키를 몇 개 먹을지 고민하는 건 시간 낭비다" 글쎄요

translation.en: -There we go. Chefs everywhere. -[woman] It says, "everything."
translation.ko: - 전부 라벨을 붙여요 - 잘했어요 - '전부'라고 했어요 - 셰프는 어디나 있죠

translation.en: -Yeah. -Roy likes it.
[Roy] Like, you took my words too literally.
I heard you were here before they even opened.
translation.ko: 이 가게가 창업하기도 전에 여기 살았다면서요

translation.en: I grew up right here in this area. This store here--
translation.ko: 이 지역에서 자랐죠 이 가게 자리는...

translation.en: -This was my Baskin-Robbins. Yeah. -This was his Baskin-Robbins.
-Bittersweet. -I have mixed feelings.
But no, this was my Baskin-Robbins, but I'm so happy she's here.
translation.ko: 예전에 배스킨라빈스를 좋아했지만 지금은 이 가게가 있어서 좋아요

translation.en: I've been involved with Christina for a long time.
translation.ko: 크리스티나와 오랫동안 알고 지냈죠 "크리스티나 토시 밀크 바 주인"

translation.en: I mean, her first book tour, we did at Chego.
translation.ko: "크리스티나 토시 밀크 바 주인" 첫 번째 북 투어를 '체고'에서 했어요

translation.en: [Christina] You have this book. The publisher's like, "How are you gonna promote it?" [laughs]
translation.ko: 이 책인데요, 출판사에서 그랬죠 '홍보는 어떻게 하실래요?'

translation.en: And you're like, "I have this one friend in LA.
-Maybe I can call him and see." -That's great.
So I'm like, "Roy." And he's like,
-"We'll do old-school bake-sale style." -Sale.
"I got a folding table. We'll put you out on the street."
It's like, if you're gonna learn how to cook for a bake sale,
translation.ko: 이런 거네요, 빵 바자회용 조리법을 배운다면

translation.en: -who would you want as your secret weapon? -[Roy] Yeah.
translation.ko: - 누굴 비밀 무기로 쓰고 싶죠? - 맞아요

translation.en: -For you to get perspective-- -I grew up on bake sales.
translation.ko: - 그런 관점에서... - 제가 빵 바자회 하면서 컸거든요

translation.en: -[Roy] I know, that's your whole-- -It is my tried-and-true.
translation.ko: - 네, 그럼 이게 다 전부... - 여러 번 만들면서 검증된 거죠

translation.en: I will pull over the side of the road
to go to a bake sale and spend $20 and get baked goods that run the gamut.
translation.ko: 빵 바자회에 들러서 20달러어치 다양한 빵을 살 거예요

translation.en: So we wanted to use this to, like--
Take back the bake sale.
Take back the bake sale, and also offer something.
translation.ko: 빵 바자회를 되살려서 이렇게 제안하는 거죠

translation.en: You know what? Just pause, and then let's try to make a good cookie,
translation.ko: '저기요, 잠깐 들러서 맛있는 쿠키를 만들어 보세요'

translation.en: make a good brownie.
-My favorite cookie… -[Jon] Uh-huh.
has been my favorite cookie at Milk Bar since the very beginning.
It was the cornflake, chocolate chip, marshmallow cookie.
[Jon] It's really good.
Look at how much cornflake crunch goes into this cookie.
translation.ko: 콘플레이크가 얼마나 많이 들어가는지 보세요 - 이 쿠키에요 - 네

translation.en: -Goes into this. Yes. -Yeah.
[Christina] This is caramelized cornflakes. It's cornflakes.
translation.ko: 캐러멜 옷을 입힌 콘플레이크죠 콘플레이크에는 설탕, 소금, 분유가 들어가요

translation.en: There's some sugar, some salt, some milk powder.
You know, people are always really scared of salt in their baked goods.
translation.ko: 베이킹할 때 소금 넣는 걸 많이들 두려워하세요

translation.en: -You need salt and you need acid. -Yeah.
But making anything taste good requires that balance.
translation.ko: 하지만 맛있는 걸 만들 땐 균형이 필요하죠

translation.en: -This is cultured butter. -[Jon] That gives you acid, the culture?
translation.ko: - 이건 발효 버터예요 - 여기서 산을 얻나요? 발효니까요

translation.en: It gives you a bit of acid, but the thing a lot of home cooks don't think about is
translation.ko: 산이 조금 있긴 하죠 그렇지만 가정에서 요리하실 때 많이들 생각 안 하시는 게

translation.en: that your baking powder and baking soda, which are what you use for leavener,
translation.ko: 베이킹파우더나 베이킹 소다처럼 팽창제로 쓰는 물질에서 산을 얻을 수 있어요

translation.en: that's where you get the acid.
translation.ko: 팽창제로 쓰는 물질에서 산을 얻을 수 있어요

translation.en: [Jon] I don't understand. Wait.
Baking powder and baking soda. Can you tell me the difference?
translation.ko: 베이킹파우더와 베이킹 소다요 둘의 차이가 뭔가요?

translation.en: Okay, so baking powder is a leavener.
It gives acid.
-[Jon] Okay. -It also helps with texture.
And baking powder is typically double-acting,
translation.ko: 베이킹파우더는 일반적으로 두 가지 작용을 해요

translation.en: so it activates as a leavener when it hits heat the first time.
translation.ko: 그래서 열을 가하면 팽창제로 작용하죠 - 그게 하나고요 - 네

translation.en: If it hits another acid, it will react again.
translation.ko: 다른 산을 만나면 다시 반응하게 됩니다

translation.en: -As a leavener? -[Christina] It'll lift again.
translation.ko: - 팽창제도 되면서요? - 다시 부풀게 하고요, 네

translation.en: So what would you add to baking powder to make it lift?
translation.ko: 그럼 뭘 넣어야 베이킹파우더가 빵을 부풀리게 되죠?

translation.en: This is a good one! You know the science fair?
translation.ko: 좋은 예가 있어요! 과학 전시회 아시죠?

translation.en: -And you build the volcano? -Yes, the volcano.
translation.ko: - 거기 화산 모형 있잖아요? - 네, 화산요

translation.en: -Right. -Baking powder, vinegar.
-Vinegar in there because it's acid. -[whooshing] Yeah.
I gotcha. Mentos and Diet Coke.
-Same. Similar. -Same thing.
-You can feel it happening in here. -Yes.
[Christina] So we add the light brown sugar and granulated sugar.
The secret to any great chocolate chip cookie is the dark vanilla extract.
translation.ko: 맛있는 초코칩 쿠키를 만드는 제 비결은 다크 바닐라 추출액이죠

translation.en: But you'll also use the white vanilla for other things.
translation.ko: 다른 거 만드실 땐 화이트 바닐라도 쓰시겠죠

translation.en: -Look at--I like that you came in ready. -[Jon] Yeah. Yeah.
translation.ko: - 보세요... - 네 - 준비가 돼 있으셔서 너무 좋네요 - 네

translation.en: -That creamy vanilla is birthday vibe. -[Jon] Yeah.
-It's the fake vanilla. Yeah, okay. -That's dreamy, fake vanilla,
translation.ko: - 그건 가짜 바닐라죠, 네 - 그건 감미로운 가짜 바닐라예요

translation.en: which I would never use, baking these cookies.
translation.ko: 저는 이런 쿠키를 만들 때 절대 쓰지 않아요

translation.en: But we cream this sucker in total for ten minutes, which is unheard of.
translation.ko: 10분 동안 이걸 전부 반죽할게요, 전례 없는 방식이죠

translation.en: So in your style of baking, are you using metric? Are you using pounds?
translation.ko: 베이킹하실 때 미터법을 쓰세요? 아니면 파운드를 쓰세요?

translation.en: We're using metric. We use weight to the gram.
translation.ko: 저희는 미터법을 쓰죠 무게는 그램을 써요

translation.en: -[Roy] Yeah. -If it's a small amount,
to the tenth of the 100th of a gram.
But most home-baking recipes are by cups and teaspoons.
translation.ko: 하지만 대부분의 홈베이킹에서는 컵과 티스푼을 쓰죠

translation.en: -They are. -Is it part of the problem?
It's always part of the problem.
-With the bread, it's all… Like with-- -Yeah.
-Bread is all grams and weighed in metric. -Has to be weighed in metric.
translation.ko: - 빵은 다 그램이죠, 미터법 써요 - 미터법으로 무게를 재야죠

translation.en: [Christina] You don't need a crazy gem scale. You just need something.
translation.ko: 아주 정밀한 보석 저울까진 필요 없어요, 그냥 저울이면 돼요

translation.en: If all three of us made a cup of flour,
translation.ko: 우리 셋이 각각 밀가루 한 컵을 재면

translation.en: -it'd weigh different across the board. -That's right.
When we write our cookbooks, the publishers maybe hate me a little bit,
translation.ko: 요리책을 쓸 때 출판사에서 절 싫어할 수도 있어요

translation.en: but I'm like, "No, we're gonna give it to them in grams
translation.ko: 하지만 전 항상 이러죠 '아뇨, 그램 단위로 알려줘야죠'

translation.en: 'cause that's how we do it, and we're not going to be a part of the bad bake sales.
translation.ko: '우리가 그렇게 하니까요 빵 바자회도 망치고 싶지 않고요'

translation.en: Yeah.
-All right, where did you put my egg? -[Roy] I got it here.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 달걀은 어디 있죠? 여기 있어요

translation.en: Amazing.
So we want it to aerate for sure
translation.ko: 그런 다음 반죽에 공기가 통하게 해야 해요

translation.en: because the second you add that egg yolk, it forces the emulsification
translation.ko: 그래야 두 번째로 난황을 넣을 때 버터와 설탕이 결합해

translation.en: -of the butter and the sugar. -Yeah.
[Christina] It strengthens that bond. And we need this to be super strong
translation.ko: 공기가 그런 결합을 강화하죠 결합이 강해야 해요

translation.en: because you know when your cookies… Some of it bakes out lacy and flat
translation.ko: 쿠키를 구웠을 때 얇고 평평하게 퍼지거나

translation.en: -and you can see the butter baking out? -Yeah, yeah.
It's because you didn't take enough time here.
translation.ko: 이 단계에 충분히 시간을 할애하지 않아서죠

translation.en: [Jon] Yeah.
Speaking of lacy cookies, there are good lacy cookies.
translation.ko: 레이스 쿠키 중에 맛있는 레이스 쿠키가 있잖아요

translation.en: -The chocolate chip ones that are-- -Oh, yeah.
-[Roy] That are crispy on the edges. -Oh, yeah.
How do you get that cookie versus just a regular chocolate chip cookie?
translation.ko: 그런 쿠키는 보통 초코칩 쿠키와는 만드는 법이 어떻게 다르죠?

translation.en: So when you're making that kind of cookie,
-and you want it to be purposefully lacy-- -Almost a palmiers texture, right?
translation.ko: - 의도적으로 얇게 만들려면... - 팔미에 같은 질감으로요

translation.en: [Christina] You're not playing this crazy whipping game.
translation.ko: 이런 휘핑기 같은 건 안 써도 돼요

translation.en: It's not about giving it aeration.
It's just about the ratio of flour to sugar to butter.
And it'll naturally bake out.
-Yeah. Because the melted-- -What are those Pepperidge Farm ones
translation.ko: - 네, 녹게 되니까요... - 페퍼리지 팜에서 나온

translation.en: -that they dip in chocolate? -Yeah. Oh!
-Those are really good. -[Christina] Why can't I bake those?
translation.ko: - 그거 정말 맛있죠 - 전 왜 그런 걸 못 만들까요?

translation.en: The most ones you see at bakeries are the chocolate chip, but then it…
translation.ko: 베이커리에 가장 많은 게 초코칩 쿠키인데, 어릴 땐...

translation.en: -I grew up on the iced oatmeal ones. -Yes.
-Remember those? -Yes.
Those were so good.
I used to load Pepperidge Farm cookies onto trucks in Queens.
translation.ko: 전 퀸스에서 페퍼리지 팜 쿠키를 트럭에 실은 적 있어요

translation.en: -Stop it. -[Jon] We were kids in school.
The drivers would tip us.
-We'd wait by the distribution center. -That's a dream job.
translation.ko: - 유통 센터에서 기다리고 있다가 - 꿈의 직업이네요

translation.en: And we would go pick out their boxes and load up their trucks.
-[Roy] And load it up. -Yeah. That was it.
-[Roy laughs] -[Christina] I love that.
[Christina] This is flour, salt, baking powder,
-baking soda. -[Jon] Right.
We know we need to add this, so the secret to this mixing is
translation.ko: 이걸 첨가해야 하는데요 이번에 섞을 때 비결은

translation.en: that we want to mix this part of it as little as possible.
[Jon] Right.
[Christina] That's it.
[Jon] Is that all you would mix right there?
-[Christina] I'll mix this other stuff in. -[Jon] Because you'll do that too.
translation.ko: - 네, 나머지는 다 섞을 거예요 - 그것도 해야 하잖아요

translation.en: -[Christina] These are sea salt bars. -What are the biggest flaws you see
translation.ko: - 이건 바다 소금 같은데요 - 집에서 쿠키 만들 때

translation.en: in just everyday home-baking cookies? What I see is, it's either too chalky--
translation.ko: 제일 큰 문제가 뭘까요? 제 생각엔 식감이 너무 분필 같고

translation.en: -[Christina] Mm-hmm. Yes. -and hard as a rock.
No one creams their butter and their sugar long enough.
translation.ko: 버터와 설탕을 충분히 섞지 않아서 그래요

translation.en: -Yup. -Ever.
It's like two seconds, zoom, zoom, zoom, we're done.
translation.ko: 2초 정도 촥, 촥, 촥 하고 끝이죠

translation.en: Yeah. They're probably doing the first phase that long.
translation.ko: 네, 첫 번째 단계에서 충분히 섞을 수도 있는데

translation.en: They're doing the second phase as long as we did the first phase--
translation.ko: 두 번째 단계를 첫 번째만큼 오래 섞는단 말이죠

translation.en: -They're doing this. -you gotta swap them.
translation.ko: - 네, 이렇게 하죠 - 반대로 해야 하는데요

translation.en: They overmix it, which is why you get the chalky, hard cookie.
translation.ko: 그렇게 너무 섞기 때문에 쿠키가 분필 같고 딱딱해지죠

translation.en: -Once you add the flour-- -Like, the gluten forms?
-Yes. -You've taught him so well.
You're really getting…
I don't ever tell anyone this stuff because it feels very…
translation.ko: 아무한테도 얘기 안 한 건데요 이게 아주...

translation.en: -Nerdy? -Well, no, I like being a nerd,
translation.ko: - 괴짜 같나요? - 아뇨, 전 괴짜가 되는 건 좋은데

translation.en: but the details of it are overbearing in the spirit of something
-that should be pure unadulterated joy. -No, you don't understand. It helps
translation.ko: - 빼앗는 것 같거든요 - 아뇨, 모르시는 거예요

translation.en: because once I understand the principles, I can apply it to other things.
translation.ko: 원리를 이해하면 다른 것에도 적용할 수 있으니까 도움이 돼요

translation.en: Yes. It is funny if you think about that. You go to culinary school
translation.ko: 네, 그렇게 생각한다니 재미있네요 요리 학교에 가는 이유도 기본적인 기술을 배우기 위해서죠

translation.en: because you have to learn the basic technique.
translation.ko: 요리 학교에 가는 이유도 기본적인 기술을 배우기 위해서죠

translation.en: -Yes. -But the instinct is something
that you pick up word-of-mouth
-along the way. Trial and error. -Yeah.
You have to learn how other people do it to figure out what your palate wants.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들의 방식을 배워야죠 자기 미각에 맞는 걸 찾으려면요

translation.en: -Yes. -How someone seasons their cookie dough
translation.ko: - 네 - 그러니까 제가 쿠키 반죽 간을 하는 방식은

translation.en: is probably totally different than the way I do it.
translation.ko: 다른 사람과 완전히 다를 수 있어요

translation.en: -Yes. -But I also bake like I'm a cook
because I liked hanging out with the savory cooks on my way up.
translation.ko: 베이킹을 하죠, 음식 요리사들과 어울리는 걸 좋아했으니까요

translation.en: You tasted, you went.
translation.ko: 맛을 보고 또 해 보고 그랬어요

translation.en: So all of this ridiculous mass goes in.
That's so cool.
[Christina] Chocolate.
Marshmallows.
And then, for here, I'm pulsing like…
-[Jon] You're keeping it… -[Christina] That's it.
…as short as you can, yeah? As far as…
-[Roy] Wow, that was fast. -[Jon] Oh, wow.
[Christina] If you look at this dough, it's a very light-colored dough.
translation.ko: 이 반죽을 보시면 아주 색이 연하죠

translation.en: [Jon] Yes.
This looks like a Halloween cookie almost. You could add Reese's Pieces, orange--
translation.ko: 이건 거의 핼러윈 쿠키 같은데요 리세스 피세스나 오렌지를 넣어도 되겠네요

translation.en: You could add so many different things into there.
translation.ko: 다양하게 여러 가지를 넣을 수 있겠죠

translation.en: I'm gonna put you on scooping duty.
-[Jon] Yes. -[Christina] You've done your homework.
translation.ko: - 네 - 숙제를 다 하신 거 같아요

translation.en: Fill the whole scooper and then bottoms it off with the palm of your hand.
-[Jon] Salmonella. -[Christina] Please stop.
These nice, little mountain tops are perfect
translation.ko: 멋진 작은 동산 모양이 되면 아주 잘된 거예요

translation.en: because the cookie is largely butter.
And so the taller we can make them, the less flat they'll get.
They go into the fridge and we get 'em super cold before they go into the oven.
translation.ko: 냉장고에 넣을 거예요 오븐에 넣기 전에 아주 차갑게 만들 겁니다

translation.en: -They keep their shape longer? -[Christina] Mm-hmm.
-[Jon] Do they cook well-- -And we added so much extra butter in.
translation.ko: - 잘 익을까요... - 버터를 아주 많이 넣어서

translation.en: We wanna give that butter a fighting chance before the heat hits it.
translation.ko: 열기가 닿기 전에 버터가 버틸 수 있게 해주려고요

translation.en: -[Christina] All right, we're coming in. -[Roy] Hello. Wow.
[Jon growls] Here we are.
-[Christina] And that's it. -[Roy] Let's go.
[Jon] And what's this?
[Christina] This is a super deepened graham pie shell.
translation.ko: 이건 아주 진하게 만든 통밀 파이 껍질이에요

translation.en: As long as I can add butter, sugar, salt, a little bit of milk powder,
translation.ko: 버터, 설탕, 소금, 약간의 분유만 첨가할 수 있으면

translation.en: -anything can be a crust. -[Jon] Wow.
translation.ko: 뭐든지 파이 껍질이 될 수 있죠

translation.en: So this was your first, kind of, attempt--
This is my first vehicle of dessert.
translation.ko: 제가 만든 디저트 중에 처음으로 잘 팔렸던 거예요

translation.en: …to define the bridge between who you were and who you're becoming?
translation.ko: 당신의 과거와 미래를 연결하는 가교가 되어 준 제품이죠

translation.en: Yeah. I was a crazy home baker
before I moved to New York to go to culinary school and do all this stuff.
translation.ko: 요리를 배우기 전에는 홈베이킹에 미친 사람이었죠

translation.en: I never wanted to lose that piece of it
translation.ko: 그런 부분을 절대 잃고 싶지가 않았어요

translation.en: because I knew there was something there that was true to me.
translation.ko: 왜냐하면 제 진솔한 모습이 거기에 있다고 생각했거든요

translation.en: -The home-baker side? Yeah. -[Christina] The home-baker side.
When you're making a brownie at home, sometimes you swirl stuff in it.
translation.ko: 집에서 브라우니를 만들 때 때로 뭔가를 섞어 보잖아요

translation.en: Like, why can't you just put the batter of a brownie into a pie crust and bake it?
translation.ko: 브라우니 반죽을 파이 껍질에 넣고 구워 볼 수도 있잖아요?

translation.en: Like, why not? The graham that's in the brownie batter will start to bridge
translation.ko: 왜 안 되겠어요? 브라우니 반죽에 들어간 통밀 크래커 가루가

translation.en: what will happen on your palate.
translation.ko: 파이 맛을 이어주는 역할을 할 겁니다

translation.en: [Roy] Going back to bake sales, the most flaws I usually encounter are, they're chalky.
translation.ko: 빵 바자회 시절엔 가장 큰 문제가 부스러진다는 거였죠

translation.en: Where is that coming from for the--
-The chalkiness? It's bad chocolate. -[Roy] …average home baker?
translation.ko: - 부스러지는 거요? - 홈베이킹 할 때요 아주 안 좋은 초콜릿이라 그래요

translation.en: Yes. Don't skimp on the ingredient, right?
[Christina] Yes.
There's really no substitution for really good chocolate,
really good cocoa powder. The darker, the deeper, the better.
translation.ko: 대신할 만한 건 정말 없어요 더 진한 색에 깊은 맛일수록 좋죠

translation.en: You don't just go to the supermarket, buy the chips or the nibs and melt it?
translation.ko: 그냥 슈퍼마켓에서 초코칩이나 카카오 닙을 사서 녹이면 안 돼요?

translation.en: I do when I'm using chocolate chips because they're semi-sweet.
translation.ko: 저도 초코칩을 쓸 때는 그렇게 하죠, 약간 달거든요

translation.en: Also the fancy chocolate people don't make mini chocolate chips.
translation.ko: 고급 초콜릿 쪽에서는 작은 초코칩은 안 만들어요

translation.en: -Yeah. -[all laugh]
[Christina] So take that out of the bowl.
-[Jon] These guys? Okay. -[Christina] Yeah. Let me get spoons
translation.ko: - 이거 말씀이죠? 알겠어요 - 네 스푼으로 맛을 좀 보죠

translation.en: so we can taste it.
[Jon] Dang.
[Jon] Wanna lick?
You always know who's on the chocolate station
when you walk into the kitchen because they're always…
-It's impossible. You're being covered-- -Me, it'd be my face covered with it.
translation.ko: - 모를 수가 없죠, 초콜릿으로... - 저는 얼굴에 뒤덮일걸요

translation.en: [Christina] And this just goes straight into the pie crust.
-[Jon] And it'll settle on its own? -[Chrisitna] It'll settle on its own.
translation.ko: 이렇게만 해도 자리가 잡히나요? 그렇게만 해도 자리가 잡혀요

translation.en: There's little graham compared to what you're doing with the cookie
translation.ko: 쿠키 만드실 때랑 비교하면 통밀이 적은데

translation.en: because it's disappeared and been incorporated.
translation.ko: 반죽 속에 들어가 있어서 그렇게 보이는 거죠

translation.en: Yes. And it starts to break up a little bit,
so it's almost like a graham-y brownie batter.
translation.ko: 그래서 거의 통밀 브라우니 반죽 같죠

translation.en: [Jon] I can see what you're saying.
[Christina] One of my favorite things with chocolate
translation.ko: 초콜릿을 쓸 때 제가 제일 좋아하는 건

translation.en: is to play off of the acidity with another acidity.
translation.ko: 그 안의 산이 다른 산과 각축을 벌이게 하는 거죠

translation.en: And my favorite thing in that space is mint.
translation.ko: 초콜릿과 같이 넣기 제일 좋은 게 민트죠

translation.en: Mint has a zest, but it also has a bite to it.
translation.ko: 민트는 풍미가 있어요 동시에 아린 맛이 있고요

translation.en: So we make this strangely gooey mixture.
This is white chocolate.
You don't have to spend that much money because nice white chocolate is
translation.ko: 이건 비싼 거 살 필요 없어요 화이트초콜릿은 좋아 봤자

translation.en: -all the same thing. -It's just milk, solid.
translation.ko: - 다 똑같거든요 - 그냥 우유 굳힌 거죠

translation.en: [Christina] We add cream cheese.
Some oil.
-[Jon] What, grape seed? -[Christina] I like grape seed.
translation.ko: 포도씨유인가요? 저는 포도씨유 좋아해요 우린 향과 색이 없는 기름만 써요

translation.en: We only use a flavorless, colorless oil
translation.ko: 저는 포도씨유 좋아해요 우린 향과 색이 없는 기름만 써요

translation.en: -unless we want the oil to have a role. -I see.
translation.ko: - 기름이 특별한 일을 안 할 때요 - 알겠습니다

translation.en: We add confectioner's sugar. I'll let you pop that in.
translation.ko: 가루 설탕을 넣습니다 존이 넣어 주세요

translation.en: [Jon] Okay.
The secret to anything that you want to taste like a great mint
is a mixture of peppermint and spearmint as extracts.
[Roy] You combine with the food coloring?
-[Christina] Exactly. -[Jon] I see.
[Christina] We'll take it and dollop it into different places on this pie.
translation.ko: 이걸 가져다가 파이의 여러 곳에 듬뿍 올릴 겁니다

translation.en: [Jon] Look how pretty she makes her top.
[Christina] So I'm basically making little cheesecake swirl.
-Look how cool. -Oh, yeah.
See, you're acting like it's nothing, you just whatever.
translation.ko: 뭘 하시든 간에 아무것도 아닌 것처럼 하세요

translation.en: There's such an effortlessness.
But this is also, like, years of being like, 10, 11, 12-year-old
with my toothpick in my mom's home kitchen--
Yes.
…trying to figure out how to get the swirls just right.
translation.ko: 소용돌이무늬를 딱 맞게 만들 방법을 찾으려고요

translation.en: Each one of them is the same, and yet each one of them is a little different.
translation.ko: 각각의 무늬가 같으면서도 조금씩 다르게 만들어야 해요

translation.en: Do you sell this at Milk Bar?
-[Christina] For special occasions. -[Roy] Okay.
And then we give it a little ring around
of mini marshmallows and mini chocolate chips.
translation.ko: 미니 초코칩을 고리 모양으로 빙 둘러서 얹어 주세요

translation.en: [Jon] High-end marshmallows don't always lead to better…
-S'mores. Yeah. -…baked products. No.
They don't. Because they're all natural and all that.
translation.ko: 그렇진 않죠 - 그럼 필요한 게... - 다 천연 재료라 좀 그렇죠

translation.en: So you've embraced your childhood flavors
-and products. -[Christina] I love the childhood flavors.
translation.ko: - 이용하신 거네요 - 전 어린 시절의 맛이 좋아요

translation.en: I think where Christina and I are similar in cooking is,
translation.ko: 요리에서 크리스티나와 제가 비슷하다고 생각하는 부분은

translation.en: we will mix high and low together.
That's right.
A lot of chefs, sometimes, are too snooty to do that.
translation.ko: 많은 셰프들이 너무 도도해서 그렇게 못 할 때가 있어요

translation.en: -[Jon] That's a good point. -But sometimes you can't replace
a old-fashioned marshmallow.
I believe that, like, everyone wants to be spoken to
on some level. Everyone's in search of connection.
translation.ko: 대화하고 싶어 한다고 생각해요 모두가 연관성을 찾죠

translation.en: And with food, the easiest way to speak to someone
translation.ko: 음식은요, 누군가가 이미 알고 있는 것으로

translation.en: -is through something they already know. -[Jon] So beautiful.
translation.ko: - 말을 거는 가장 쉬운 방법이죠 - 참 멋지네요

translation.en: -That's it. We put it on a sheet tray. -Beautiful.
-[Christina] Off to the oven. -Is this it?
-This is the first one. -[Jon] Is that it?
[Christina] Once it gets baked off.
-We'll bake this one off so it's true. -We'll bake it, but we don't have to pretend this is it.
translation.ko: - 이걸 구우면 정말 그렇게 되죠 - 이게 그거인 척하지 않아도 돼요

translation.en: The other thing we do is, we Jackson Pollock glaze the top
translation.ko: 네, 하지만 또 할 일이 있어요 잭슨 폴록처럼 설탕물 입히는 거죠

translation.en: -before-- -Do we have to do that?
[Jon] What's this you're making?
-[Christina] This is just a mint drizzle. -[Jon] A drizzle?
[Christina] And then we Jackson Pollock the pie.
translation.ko: 이걸로 파이에 잭슨 폴록처럼 뿌리는 거예요

translation.en: You stand on a ladder above it and--
We just stand a little above it and start to give it the splatter.
Do you want to Jackson Pollock?
-I'll give it a shot. -[Christina] All right.
-[Jon] How am I doing here? -[Christina] Good.
translation.ko: - 저 잘하고 있나요, 셰프? - 네, 좋아요

translation.en: [Jon] Now go the other way?
-Am I going too-- -[Christina] You're good.
translation.ko: - 제가 너무 좀... - 됐어요, 아니, 잘하셨어요

translation.en: You pull it out from under me when I'm going too far.
translation.ko: 제가 너무 많이 나갔다 싶으면 파이를 그냥 치우세요

translation.en: [Christina] There's no right or wrong way.
Do you want to add to this?
-This? -Chef?
-[Christina] He needs to… [laughs] -[Jon] That's the one--
translation.ko: - 네, 해 보셔야... 네! - 이거 한 번...

translation.en: You wanna cut into this sucker?
They taught me in school the most important part is tasting.
translation.ko: 네, 학교에선 맛보기가 제일 중요하다고 배웠어요

translation.en: -Is tasting. -[Christina] Tasting.
-[Jon] Cuts easy, don't it? -[Christina] Mm-hmm.
We bake it. It poofs. And then…
I don't know about you, but I like a fudgy-in-the-center brownie.
translation.ko: 여러분은 어떤지 몰라도 저는 안에 진한 초콜릿이 든 브라우니가 좋아요

translation.en: -Yes. -You got it. I can feel it already.
[Christina] Nice.
-[Jon] That's really good. -That's a bake sale. They're so good.
translation.ko: - 정말 맛있어요 - 이게 빵 바자회죠, 참 맛있네요

translation.en: Right? The textures are so great.
[Christina] Texture of the marshmallows on top, I just cannot get away from.
I'll go around and pick them off of every bite.
translation.ko: 여러분들이 다 같이 맛볼 수 있게 돌릴게요

translation.en: [Jon] It's really good.
[Roy] Well, we solved the cookie and the brownie. Now, we got the cake.
translation.ko: 쿠키와 브라우니를 만들어 봤고요 이번에는 케이크입니다

translation.en: You can't come to Milk Bar without making a layer cake.
translation.ko: 밀크 바에 오셨으니 레이어 케이크는 만들어 보셔야죠

translation.en: -Yes. -[Roy] Layer cake.
-Few more steps than a cookie, but worth-- -However,
I was thrown when I saw the mise
because I've never seen that in a layer cake.
translation.ko: 보통 레이어 케이크에선 못 봤던 것들이라서요

translation.en: You're here, so why the heck not
translation.ko: 여러분이 오셨으니 사치 좀 부리는 게

translation.en: -roll out the red carpet? -Why not?
It's a recipe we've been working on for a few months
translation.ko: 이 레시피는 생일 케이크 출시 이후

translation.en: -since we came out with the birthday cake. -This is the chocolate birthday cake?
translation.ko: - 여러 달 걸려 만들었어요 - 이건 초콜릿 생일 케이크죠?

translation.en: It's the chocolate birthday cake because not everyone is here for all the vanilla.
translation.ko: 초콜릿 생일 케이크예요 모두가 바닐라를 좋아하진 않죠

translation.en: [Christina] Mixing cake is like mixing a cookie,
-in theory. -Right.
-It starts with butter. Get it in there. -[Roy] Cream. Cream first.
[Christina] We're gonna add light brown sugar and granulated sugar.
And then ditto with the dark vanilla extract
because chocolate cake should be dark and rich.
translation.ko: 초콜릿 케이크는 진하고 풍미가 있어야 하니까요

translation.en: So we take a bunch of eggs, and we blend them down for our cakes.
How do you know how many eggs you're adding?
We weigh them. A large egg is about 50 grams.
translation.ko: 저희는 무게로 얘기하는데요 큰 달걀 한 개가 50g 정도 되죠

translation.en: -We try to pour the oil in first. -What's this on the bottom?
translation.ko: - 먼저 기름을 넣어 보죠 - 바닥에 깔린 건 뭐죠?

translation.en: That's buttermilk. We layer our oil and our buttermilk.
Oil is always the key to moist cake?
-[Christina] Oil is the key to moist cake. -[Jon] Buttermilk, now you have your acid.
translation.ko: 케이크를 촉촉하게 하려면 기름이 중요하죠 그럼 버터밀크에는 산도 있고, 지방도 있는 거네요

translation.en: -You have your fat. -[Christina] Exactly.
translation.ko: 그럼 버터밀크에는 산도 있고, 지방도 있는 거네요 맞아요

translation.en: [Jon] If it's not looking glossy, what do you add more of?
translation.ko: 광택이 많이 나지 않으면 뭘 더 넣어야 하나요?

translation.en: -You just keep-- -Blending?
You keep blending. Again, it's the most common mistake.
translation.ko: 계속 섞으세요 이게 가장 흔한 실수인데요

translation.en: You don't want to change measurements because it's chemistry.
translation.ko: 양을 조절하고 싶으시진 않겠죠 이건 화학이니까요

translation.en: -You don't just start-- -It's science.
translation.ko: - 그냥 뭘 더 넣으면 안 돼요... - 과학이거든요

translation.en: -[Jon] So all of your control-- -I'll just add a little bit more oil.
translation.ko: - 그럼 전부 통제하시는... - '기름을 조금만 더 넣어 볼까?'

translation.en: -No, but we do. -[Christina] Yeah.
That's what we do. So you're manipulating all of it
translation.ko: 우린 그렇게 하죠 그럼 모든 것을 다 통제하시네요

translation.en: -through time and-- -And it's time and agitations.
That's where things go wrong. Remember when we were making the beignets?
translation.ko: 거기서 문제가 생기는 거 같아요 베녜 만들었을 때 생각나요?

translation.en: We were adding and changing the ratios a little bit.
translation.ko: 우린 재료를 추가하고 비율을 조금씩 바꾸고 그랬죠

translation.en: -[Roy] A little bit. -Yeah.
[groans] Du Monde?
Yeah, but it was three years old.
I think I have a three-year-old box of Café Du Monde.
translation.ko: 저도 카페 뒤 몽드에서 주문한 지 3년쯤 된 거 같아요

translation.en: No, we got a fresh box, and we redid it.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 저흰 새로 주문해서 다시 만들었죠

translation.en: [Christina] This is cake flour, baking powder, salt.
translation.ko: 이건 케이크 밀가루와 베이킹파우더, 소금을 섞은 거죠

translation.en: [Jon] Now we wanna go--
-[Christina] As little as possible. -…short, high-speed short,
-or medium-speed short? -Medium-speed short.
We want to mix it for as little as humanly possible.
-[Jon] Now, probably stop it. -[Christina] You can stop it.
-Scrape it? -And my method is always you can finish
translation.ko: - 긁어낼까요? - 제 방법은 항상 반죽할 때

translation.en: mixing anything and everything by hand.
[Jon] So it's folding more
-because you don't want to collapse it? -[Christina] Yeah.
I'm so proud. I could just retire. You could take my job for me. He's on it.
translation.ko: 정말 자랑스럽네요. 제가 은퇴해도 존이 대신하면 되겠어요 그냥 하시잖아요

translation.en: I'm just here for show. He's doin' it all.
translation.ko: 전 그냥 출연만 하고 있어요 존이 다 하네요

translation.en: [Christina] So the batter goes in.
[Jon] Just do this?
[Christina] Yeah, exactly. You're spreading them in.
[Jon] I see.
-[Christina] Perfect. -[Jon] Okay.
[Christina] This side of the spatula is 90 degrees.
So rather than bring my spatula back, I get a little batter underneath it.
translation.ko: 그래서 주걱을 가져다가 반죽을 좀 밑에 넣을게요

translation.en: And then just wedge it into the corners.
There we go.
And then, for this guy, because, even though it's cake, we still love texture,
translation.ko: 이 친구가 케이크이긴 하지만 저흰 식감을 사랑하니까요

translation.en: we just sprinkle some of our nice mini little chocolate chips.
translation.ko: 질 좋은 미니 초코칩을 좀 뿌리죠

translation.en: This is a very fancy cake batter, and that's well and good,
translation.ko: 케이크 반죽이 정말 잘됐어요 모든 게 다 좋아요

translation.en: but, like, you can't take the girl out of the suburbs. A little bit.
translation.ko: 그래도 예전에 대한 향수를 잊을 수는 없는 법이죠, 조금은요

translation.en: And what's your go-to mini chip?
[Christina] Anything that's semi-sweet is nice. Milk chocolate is saved
translation.ko: 약간 달기만 하면 다 괜찮아요 밀크 초콜릿은 허쉬 초코바용으로 남겨둬야죠

translation.en: for my Hershey's candy bar,
-Reese's Peanut Butter Cup… Yeah. -For eating it directly.
[Christina] This goes in the oven 15, 20 minutes. [Jon] Okay.
-[Roy] All right. Cake? -[Christina] Chocolate cake.
A cake is done just as it starts to pull back from the edges.
In order to start working with him,
-we just have to take him out of the pan. -[Jon] I see.
[Christina] They pop out, and this piece comes back really easily.
translation.ko: 팬에서 빼내면 이 부분은 쉽게 떼어져요

translation.en: -And you just smack them. -And just literally…yeah. Boom.
translation.ko: - 그냥 탕 치시던데요 - 말 그대로 그냥... 네, 쾅

translation.en: [Jon] That was really fun. Okay.
-[Christina] You're a pro already. -[Jon] There we go.
Look at that.
[Christina] We know we need to cut it into rounds.
So why didn't you just make your first cakes into a rectangle?
translation.ko: 왜 첫 케이크를 직사각형 모양으로 하지 않았죠?

translation.en: That's a good question. Because this is nostalgia.
A rectangle cake doesn't make sense,
-doesn't tug on my heartstrings. -Yeah. Okay. Yeah.
translation.ko: - 제 감정을 자극하지 못해요 - 네, 알겠어요

translation.en: You don't need three great rounds to make a great cake.
translation.ko: 사실 3개 층이 모두 원형은 아니어도 돼요

translation.en: You only need one really great round.
-For the top. -[Christina] You…For the top.
That's one nice round.
Another as nice of a round as you can get.
[Jon, Christina] For the bottom.
[Christina] And then two almost--
-[Jon] Halves. -…half moons. Exactly.
And the chocolate chips, you gotta give them a little pounding.
translation.ko: 그리고 초코칩은 좀 다져 줘야 해요

translation.en: So you get one full three-layer cake out of one flat?
translation.ko: 직사각형 케이크 하나에서 원형 3층 케이크가 나오네요

translation.en: Out of one quarter-sheet pan, exactly.
[Jon] Roy, I'm getting into your area here.
-Is that all right? -[Christina] Territory.
[Jon] We're gonna make this perfect now.
[Christina] Perfect. These rings are gonna be our new friends.
translation.ko: 완벽해요, 이 링은 새 친구에게 갈 겁니다

translation.en: -Give 'em a little dust down. -Like a plating cylinder?
There you go. Look at you. Did you learn that from Wolfgang?
I learned it from Roy. Everything.
[Christina] Ring on cardboard becomes our new canvas.
-This stuff is acetate. -Yes.
-[Christina] So we use that as a guide. -[Jon] Okay.
-[Christina] We're gonna build from here. -[Jon] Mm-hmm.
[Christina] We're going to put our two--
-[Jon] Halves. -…half moons down first.
-[Jon] The sad round. -[Christina] The sad rounds!
And then we're gonna use the one off scraps.
-[Jon] So spread it. -We'll break them down
-to fill in the negative space. -[Jon] I see.
[Christina] So this is a soak. It's a vanilla-scented soak.
translation.ko: 이걸로 적실 거예요 바닐라 향이 들어가 있죠

translation.en: It's the dreamy vanilla vibe,
so it's a little bit of that clear vanilla extract.
You're putting about three spoonfuls of that soak down.
[Jon] So moisture and flavor-- [Christina] Moisture and flavor are key here.
[Jon] What's this one?
[Christina] This is birthday frosting. This is our from-scratch version of it.
translation.ko: 이건 생일 프로스팅이에요 저희의 맨 처음 버전이죠

translation.en: I put down usually three heaping spoonfuls.
And you're gonna do the same figure-eight ellipses.
You just want to keep your spoon in the frosting.
Poking at it will pull the layer of cake up.
translation.ko: 꾹 찌르면 케이크가 딸려 올라올 거예요

translation.en: [Jon] Okay.
These are birthday crumbs. Spread 'em around.
translation.ko: 이건 생일용 장식 과자예요 골고루 뿌려주세요

translation.en: And then, just to anchor them into the frosting.
[Roy] Okay.
So once crumb goes down--
-More frosting? -More frosting.
All right.
So we're gonna do the same thing all over. Cake, soak, frosting, crumb, frosting.
translation.ko: 이걸 반복하는 거예요 케이크, 적시기, 프로스팅 장식 과자, 프로스팅

translation.en: I actually gotta go to a birthday party after this.
translation.ko: 이거 끝나면 진짜로 생일 파티 가야 하는데요

translation.en: -No way. -This is perfect, yeah.
[Jon] I'll sell you mine.
-Yeah. -[all laugh]
Your favorite memory of birthday cake, do you have one?
translation.ko: 생일 케이크에 얽힌 가장 좋았던 추억이 있나요?

translation.en: -[Jon] Roy? -I like lemon cake, I would say.
The zing of it or the gooey pound-cake vibe?
translation.ko: 레몬 징 케이크나 촉촉한 파운드케이크 같은 거요?

translation.en: Both. Koreans grow up with pound-cake-type cake.
translation.ko: 둘 다요, 한국인들은 파운드케이크 같은 걸 많이 먹어요

translation.en: -[Jon] Really? -Yeah.
My memories are the Entenmann's that everybody sneaks in at midnight
translation.ko: 제 기억은 다들 밤중에 몰래 한 입씩 먹었던

translation.en: -to have more and disappears by morning. -But crumb cake? Like Entenmann's--
translation.ko: 엔텐먼스 케이크가 생각나요 - 아침이면 다 없어지죠 - 엔텐먼스 중에 크럼 케이크요?

translation.en: Crumb cake's good. And whatever that cheesecake,
translation.ko: 크럼 케이크는 맛있어요 스트루델 같이 생긴

translation.en: -strudel-type thing… -[Christina] Oh, yeah.
[Jon] Uh-oh…No more frosting.
This is that anxiety that comes with doing this at home.
translation.ko: 집에서 만들 때 불안한 게 이거예요

translation.en: [Christina] I know.
See, now this really is like bake sale.
translation.ko: 이건 진짜 빵 바자회에 나온 거 같은데요

translation.en: But this is right. This is the humanity of what happens in the kitchen.
translation.ko: 하지만 괜찮아요, 주방에서 볼 수 있는 인간적인 모습이죠

translation.en: [Jon] I'm gonna put one dollop in the middle. I'd cry.
translation.ko: 가운데에 한 숟갈만 얹고 울어버리는 거죠

translation.en: [Christina] Your friend would be like, "Hold on, I got…"
translation.ko: 아뇨, 친구가 이럴 거예요 - '잠깐만, 내가...' - '나한테 좀 더 있어'

translation.en: [Jon] I have extra.
Now we're talking.
-There you go. -Gimme another layer.
[Christina] You're so… I know, right? Build it to the sky.
translation.ko: 이건 뭐랄까... 하늘로 쌓아 올릴 기세네요

translation.en: [Jon] Now I'm happy. Look at this.
[Christina] The best is, you can make the top as crazy as you want.
translation.ko: 맨 위는 원하는 대로 뭐든 만들 수 있어서 제일 좋아요

translation.en: -Once you pull the sides up-- -[Roy] That's pretty.
-[Christina] Yes! -[Jon] It's called Bart Simpson.
Eraserhead.
[Christina] Look at you! It means business.
[Jon] That's very pretty, Roy, I have to say.
translation.ko: 너무 예쁘네요, 로이 말을 안 할 수가 없어요

translation.en: [Christina] He's got it.
-We're going to the freezer, guys. -[Roy] In the freezer? Okay.
[Christina] We're gonna go in the Mr. Freeze deep freeze.
[Jon] This is the one where you get somebody to confess.
[Christina] Yeah! Yeah! Where did you put the milk?
Whenever I see this, I feel like I'm on Game of Thrones.
translation.ko: 전 이거 볼 때마다 '왕좌의 게임' 같아요

translation.en: -Yeah. -This one? Oh, the Wall.
[Roy] There we go.
-[Jon] Should we check on the cookies? -[Christina] Yeah, I'm ready.
[Christina] Gentlemen…
Feast your eyes. Look at those things.
translation.ko: 눈 호강 하세요 이 쿠키들 좀 봐요

translation.en: -Excellent. -The marshmallows, you can see them
popping out in a gooey way.
And you can tell, because there's no blowouts,
translation.ko: 구멍 난 데도 없는 거 같아요

translation.en: we mixed them all properly. You see the little jewels of it.
translation.ko: 다 제대로 반죽을 잘했네요 정말 잘 나왔어요

translation.en: It was perfectly scooped is what we can tell.
translation.ko: 스쿠퍼로 떠넣기가 완벽하게 된 거 같아요

translation.en: What I'm gauging here is that it's perfectly scooped,
translation.ko: 여길 보니까 정말 완벽하게 잘된 거 같아요

translation.en: but for me that is…
the moment of it.
[Jon] I like it so much more
translation.ko: 뭐가 들어갔는지 아니까 훨씬 더 좋네요

translation.en: -now I know what's in it. -[Roy] It's delicious.
translation.ko: 뭐가 들어갔는지 아니까 훨씬 더 좋네요 맛있어요

translation.en: [Christina] We crushed that.
All these cake scraps, we don't throw 'em away. We make 'em into cake truffles.
translation.ko: 여기 케이크 부스러기가 있는데요, 버리지 마세요 이걸로 케이크 트러플을 만들 거예요

translation.en: They become the truffles? Okay. -[Christina] Yeah.
We put them all into a bowl.
We break them down. And then we add that same cake soak.
translation.ko: 잘게 부숴준 다음 아까 케이크 적셨던 걸 넣죠

translation.en: And then you're gonna knead it almost as you would a bread dough.
translation.ko: 그리고 빵 반죽처럼 되게 치대 주세요

translation.en: Compress it. It's already baked, so you're not worried about
translation.ko: 꾹꾹 눌러 주세요 이미 구운 거라 글루텐 형성은

translation.en: -developing gluten. -[Jon] Right.
[Christina] And from there, we use these scoops.
Fill 'em, compress 'em,
and we lay them out to the side there.
Roy, I'll scoop. You roll.
We sell so many of these puppies that,
when we get down, like, we get down as a team.
translation.ko: 그래서 다 같이 한 팀이 되어서 만들죠

translation.en: You come. Someone's in charge of mixing.
Someone's in charge of scooping. Someone's in charge of rolling.
translation.ko: 스쿠퍼로 푸는 사람이 있고 동그랗게 빚는 사람이 있죠

translation.en: What's the best music for making these?
translation.ko: 이런 거 만들 때 좋은 음악엔 뭐가 있을까요?

translation.en: [sighs] I think you need a very quick beat that's also a little screamy
translation.ko: 아주 빠른 박자의 곡이 좋겠죠 소리도 좀 지르고요

translation.en: because it's like going to boot camp. It's like, "Go!" [screams]
translation.ko: 신병 캠프 분위기로 가는 거죠 이러면서요, '실시!'

translation.en: -How many of these you go through? -Thousands of them.
translation.ko: - 이거 몇 개나 만드셨어요? - 수천 개는 만들었죠

translation.en: On a week, we probably sell eight to ten thousand cake truffles.
[Jon] Really?
So this is that birthday crumb with a little bit more chocolate.
translation.ko: 이건 아까 생일용 장식 과자인데 초콜릿을 조금 더 넣었어요

translation.en: And we broke it down to a sandy.
This is white chocolate that is mixed with a little bit of oil
so that it's nice and thin.
[Christina] We're gonna white chocolate hands,
-throw it over to Roy. -[Jon] Fried chicken.
[Christina] Roy is going to rake it and then pull it.
-And then as soon as it sets… -[Jon] Warm.
…it's ready to eat or ready to package.
It's chocolate, vanilla, and a truffle.
So you can get some really primo bake-sale vibe.
translation.ko: 그러면 아주 최상급 빵 바자회가 되는 거죠

translation.en: Taste some of it.
The second this sets,
there's a little of that shard of texture of white chocolate.
translation.ko: 화이트초콜릿이 부서지는 식감을 느낄 수 있죠

translation.en: -This one's gonna be a hit. -That one's gonna be a hit.
translation.ko: 이거 대박 나겠는데요 대박 날 거예요

translation.en: [Roy] So we have our bake sale now.
[Jon] You'd get that new library--
[Christina] In my imagination, this is what a bake sale should look like.
translation.ko: - 금방 생기겠는데요 - 그런 게 빵 바자회죠 맞아요

translation.en: You show up to a bake sale with that, you got two secret weapons.
translation.ko: 이걸로 빵 바자회에 나가면 비밀 무기를 장착한 거죠

translation.en: All of a sudden, you're in a different realm.
-You're in a different territory. -[Roy] You're parent of the year.
[Jon] Lightning round. If I go to the ice cream parlor, I'll get vanilla.
translation.ko: 스피드 게임입니다 아이스크림 가게에 가면 전 바닐라를 먹을 거예요

translation.en: [Christina] I'm a vanilla-ice-cream person.
[Roy] For ice cream, vanilla milkshake, chocolate.
-[Jon] Really? -[Roy] The problem growing up is my mom
translation.ko: 정말요? 어릴 때 제가 먹은 밀크셰이크의 문제는

translation.en: -used the same blender for kimchi. -[Jon] Acid. You want acid.
translation.ko: 엄마가 김치 만들던 믹서기를 쓴다는 거였죠 - 산이 좀 필요하잖아요 - 맞아요

translation.en: -[Christina] A little funk. -[all laugh]
translation.ko: - 그게 제... - 이 장난꾸러기 자막: 권오윤
